intro: Rosa lugdunensis var. microcarpa, commonly known as the miniature everblooming rose, is a compact shrub native to the British Isles. It is characterized by its dense, thornless growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white throughout the growing season. The plant has small, oval leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers are typically borne singly or in clusters. It is well-suited for container gardening and can thrive in full sun to partial shade. This variety is prized for its continuous blooming and ornamental appeal in gardens.
